requirement_title: Implement and Maintain a Business Continuity Management System (BCMS)
requirement: The organization should implement and maintain a BCMS that develops business continuity appropriate to the impact of disruptions.
requirement_description: The BCMS should be tailored to the organization's needs, legal requirements, products, processes, size, structure, and interested parties.

controls.control: Conduct a thorough analysis to identify critical business functions, assets, and dependencies that would be impacted by disruptions.
Create a clear governance structure for the BCMS, including roles, responsibilities, and reporting lines.
Develop strategies to maintain business operations during disruptions, such as alternative work locations, remote access, or outsourcing.
Regularly update and maintain documentation of the BCMS, including policies, procedures, plans, and training materials.

requirement_title: Establish Business Continuity Policies and Objectives
requirement: The organization should understand its needs and establish business continuity policies and objectives.
requirement_description: The organization should define its business continuity goals based on the potential impact of disruptions.

controls.control: Regularly assess the potential impact of various threats on critical business processes, systems, and data to prioritize resources for continuity planning.
Define specific goals for recovery time objectives (RTO), recovery point objectives (RPO), and maximum acceptable downtime to guide the development of business continuity plans.
Outline strategies for maintaining critical business functions during disruptions, including alternative methods for delivering products or services and communication with stakeholders.
Create formal policies that outline the organization's approach to business continuity management, including roles, responsibilities, and procedures.

requirement_title: Operate and Maintain Processes, Capabilities, and Response Structures
requirement: The organization should operate and maintain processes, capabilities, and response structures to ensure survival during disruptions.
requirement_description: The organization should have mechanisms in place to respond effectively to disruptions.

controls.control: Create a comprehensive plan outlining the organization's response to various disruptions, including recovery strategies and key personnel roles.
Maintain an off-site location with essential infrastructure and resources to ensure continuity of operations during a major disruption.

controls.control_title: Implement Regular Backup and Offsite Storage
controls.control: Regularly backup critical data and store off-site to minimize data loss during disruptions.
Periodically test the business continuity plan through simulated disruptions to ensure effectiveness and identify areas for improvement.

requirement_title: Monitor and Review BCMS Performance and Effectiveness
requirement: The organization should monitor and review the performance and effectiveness of the BCMS.
requirement_description: The organization should assess the efficiency and efficacy of its BCMS to ensure it meets its objectives.

controls.control: Establish a process to regularly monitor the performance of the Business Continuity Management System (BCMS) to ensure it is functioning effectively and efficiently.
Conduct periodic reviews to assess the effectiveness of the BCMS in achieving its intended objectives, such as minimizing downtime and ensuring business continuity.

controls.control_title: Document BCMS Performance and Effectiveness Findings
controls.control: Maintain records of performance and effectiveness reviews to track improvements over time, identify trends, and make data-driven decisions about BCMS enhancements.

requirement_title: Continual Improvement Based on Qualitative and Quantitative Measures
requirement: The organization should continuously improve based on qualitative and quantitative measures.
requirement_description: The organization should strive for continuous improvement in its BCMS.

controls.control: Develop, document, and implement a formal program to continuously evaluate and improve organizational performance based on both qualitative (e.g., customer feedback) and quantitative (e.g., key performance indicators) measures.
Conduct periodic reviews of organizational performance, identifying areas for improvement and setting targets for future performance.
Create a system for customers and employees to provide feedback on products, services, and processes, using this information to drive improvements.

requirement: A BCMS includes a policy, competent people with defined responsibilities, management processes, documented information supporting operational control, and performance evaluation.
requirement_description: The BCMS should have a clear structure with defined components to ensure effective operation.

controls.control: Develop, document, and communicate a Business Continuity Management System policy that outlines the organization's approach to managing risks and ensuring business continuity.
Define roles and responsibilities for individuals involved in the BCMS, including a BCMS Manager, Business Impact Analysts, and Test Managers.
Create documented processes that outline how the organization will identify, assess, manage, respond to, and recover from business disruptions.
Maintain up-to-date documentation of the BCMS, including policies, procedures, plans, and records of tests and exercises.
Regularly review and evaluate the effectiveness of the BCMS to ensure it remains fit for purpose and is continually improved.

requirement: The BCMS should have a policy.
requirement_description: The organization should have a written policy outlining its approach to business continuity.

controls.control: Create a comprehensive policy document outlining the purpose, scope, roles and responsibilities, and procedures for the Business Continuity Management System (BCMS)
Define a clear approval process for the BCMS policy document, involving key stakeholders and ensuring that all necessary parties have reviewed and approved the policy
Provide training to relevant staff members on the BCMS policy document, ensuring they understand their roles and responsibilities in maintaining business continuity
Establish a regular review schedule for the BCMS policy document to ensure its continued relevance and effectiveness, and make necessary updates as required

requirement: The BCMS should have competent people with defined responsibilities.
requirement_description: The organization should assign roles and responsibilities for managing business continuity.

controls.control: Clearly outline the roles, responsibilities, and authorities of each individual involved in the BCMS. This includes identifying a BCMS owner, coordinator, team members, and any other relevant positions.
Develop and implement a comprehensive training program to ensure that all personnel involved in the BCMS are competent and aware of their roles, responsibilities, and the BCMS procedures.

controls.control_title: Regularly Review and Update BCMS Personnel
controls.control: Periodically review the personnel involved in the BCMS to ensure they still meet the competency requirements. Update roles, responsibilities, or authorities as necessary.

Maintain up-to-date documentation of all personnel involved in the BCMS, including their roles, responsibilities, and contact information. This will facilitate effective communication and coordination during incidents.

requirement: The BCMS should have management processes for policy, planning, implementation and operation, performance assessment, management review, and continual improvement.
requirement_description: The organization should have defined processes for managing its business continuity.

controls.control: Develop, document, communicate, and maintain a comprehensive Business Continuity Management System (BCMS) policy that outlines the organization's approach to managing risks and ensuring business continuity.
Develop, document, communicate, and maintain a detailed Business Continuity Management System (BCMS) plan that outlines the steps to be taken in the event of a disruption.
Develop, document, communicate, and maintain detailed procedures for each step outlined in the BCMS plan.
Define roles and responsibilities for BCMS management, including a BCMS team, BCMS coordinator, and BCMS champion.
Provide training to all relevant personnel on their roles and responsibilities in the BCMS, as well as any necessary technical skills.
Regularly test the BCMS plan and procedures to ensure they are effective and up-to-date.
Regularly review the performance of the BCMS, identifying areas for improvement and implementing changes as necessary.
Establish a process for ongoing evaluation, improvement, and updating of the BCMS to ensure it remains effective in managing risks and ensuring business continuity.

requirement: The BCMS should have documented information supporting operational control and performance evaluation.
requirement_description: The organization should maintain records to support the operation of its BCMS and for evaluating its performance.

controls.control: Develop, maintain, and update a comprehensive documentation of the BCMS, including operational procedures, performance metrics, and evaluation methods.
Create a framework for evaluating the effectiveness and efficiency of the BCMS, including key performance indicators (KPIs) and regular review schedules.
Create detailed documentation for each operational control within the BCMS, including steps, responsibilities, and expected outcomes.

requirement: performance assessment
requirement_description: The organization should perform assessments to evaluate its performance

controls.control: Define and document the expected system performance levels, including response times, throughput, and resource utilization.
Regularly monitor system performance to ensure it meets the established baseline and identify any potential issues or bottlenecks.
Implement optimization techniques, such as caching, compression, and load balancing, to improve system performance where necessary.

requirement: management review
requirement_description: The organization should conduct regular reviews to oversee its operations

controls.control: Conduct regular meetings with senior management to discuss and review all aspects of the organization's operations, including compliance.
Perform a comprehensive risk assessment to identify potential compliance risks and develop strategies to mitigate them.
Maintain records of all management review meetings, including the agenda, minutes, action items, and follow-up actions.

requirement: continual improvement
requirement_description: The organization should strive for continuous enhancement of its capabilities

controls.control: Develop and implement a formal program to continuously evaluate, improve, and optimize business processes, products, and services.
Establish relevant KPIs for the organization's objectives and review them regularly to identify areas for improvement.
Create channels for customers, employees, and stakeholders to provide feedback on products, services, or processes. Regularly review and address this feedback to improve offerings.
Perform regular internal audits of business processes, products, and services to identify areas for improvement and ensure compliance with established policies and procedures.

requirement_title: Documented Information Supporting Operational Control and Performance Evaluation
requirement: documented information supporting operational control and enabling performance evaluation
requirement_description: The organization should maintain documented information to support its operations and evaluate performance

controls.control: Create and maintain up-to-date documentation that outlines operational procedures, policies, and responsibilities to support ongoing control and performance evaluation.
Develop measurable key performance indicators (KPIs) that align with the organization's objectives, enabling regular monitoring and evaluation of operational performance.
Document all changes made to systems, processes, or policies, including reasons for change, impact analysis, and any resulting effects on operational control or performance.

requirement: supporting strategic objectives
requirement_description: The organization should align its business continuity efforts with its strategic goals

controls.control: Clearly define, document, and communicate the organization's strategic objectives to all relevant stakeholders.
Develop measurable KPIs that align with the strategic objectives and monitor their progress regularly.
Schedule periodic reviews of the organization's strategic objectives to ensure they remain relevant and effective.

requirement: creating a competitive advantage
requirement_description: The organization should leverage its business continuity capabilities to gain an edge over competitors

controls.control: Establish an innovation management system to streamline idea generation, evaluation, and implementation processes
Invest in customer research and feedback mechanisms to improve product/service offerings and overall customer experience
Implement automated tools for competitor analysis to stay updated on market trends, products, and strategies

requirement_title: Protect and Enhance Reputation and Credibility
requirement: protecting and enhancing its reputation and credibility
requirement_description: The organization should safeguard its standing in the market by demonstrating resilience

controls.control_title: Establish a Strong Code of Ethics
controls.control: Develop and enforce a comprehensive code of ethics that guides all employees in maintaining the organization's reputation and credibility.
Regularly communicate with stakeholders about the organization's mission, values, and operations to build trust and maintain a positive image.
Implement quality control measures to ensure that all products or services provided by the organization meet high standards and consistently deliver value to customers.
Regularly monitor social media platforms for mentions of the organization, respond promptly to customer inquiries or complaints, and address any negative feedback appropriately.
Participate in community outreach programs that demonstrate the organization's commitment to social responsibility and positively impact local communities.

requirement: contributing to organizational resilience
requirement_description: The organization should build its ability to withstand and recover from disruptions

controls.control_title: Develop and Maintain Business Continuity Plan
controls.control: Create, test, and maintain a comprehensive business continuity plan that covers all critical functions and systems.
Develop and implement a disaster recovery strategy to ensure rapid recovery of critical systems and data in the event of an incident.
Regularly test backups of critical systems and data to ensure their integrity and recoverability.
Develop and implement training programs for employees on relevant topics such as incident response, disaster recovery, and business continuity.
Regularly conduct risk assessments to identify potential threats to the organization's resilience and develop strategies to mitigate those risks.

requirement: reducing legal and financial exposure
requirement_description: The organization should minimize potential losses due to disruptions

controls.control: Collect only necessary personal data and retain for limited periods
Develop, implement, and maintain a comprehensive compliance program to ensure adherence to all relevant laws and regulations.
Conduct regular risk assessments to identify potential areas of legal and financial exposure, and develop mitigation strategies as needed.
Offer ongoing compliance training for all employees to ensure they understand their roles and responsibilities in maintaining legal and financial compliance.

requirement_title: Reduce Direct and Indirect Costs of Disruptions
requirement: reducing direct and indirect costs of disruptions
requirement_description: The organization should aim to lower the overall cost impact of disruptions

controls.control: Develop, document, test, and maintain a comprehensive disaster recovery plan to minimize downtime and data loss.
Regularly assess the organization's risk profile to identify potential threats, vulnerabilities, and impacts on operations.
Install redundant systems and backup solutions for critical infrastructure components to minimize the impact of failures.
Create a dedicated business continuity team responsible for managing disruptions, coordinating responses, and ensuring recovery efforts.
Provide regular training and exercises to employees on disaster preparedness, incident response, and business continuity procedures.

requirement: protecting life, property and the environment
requirement_description: The organization should prioritize safety and environmental protection during disruptions

controls.control: Develop and maintain a comprehensive emergency response plan that includes evacuation procedures, first aid training, and regular drills.
Regularly inspect and maintain all equipment to ensure they are in safe working condition and comply with relevant safety standards.
Establish, implement, maintain, and continually improve an environmental management system that includes waste management, energy efficiency, and pollution prevention measures.
Provide regular safety training to employees, enforce the use of personal protective equipment, and encourage a culture of safety in the workplace.

requirement: considering the expectations of interested parties
requirement_description: The organization should take into account the needs and preferences of its stakeholders

controls.control: Create and maintain an open line of communication with interested parties to understand their expectations, concerns, and feedback
Develop a formal document outlining the expectations of interested parties and make it accessible to relevant personnel

controls.control_title: Periodic Review of Interested Parties Expectations
controls.control: Regularly review and update the expectations of interested parties as needed, taking into account changes in their needs or circumstances

requirement_title: Provide Confidence in Organization's Ability to Succeed
requirement: providing confidence in the organization’s ability to succeed
requirement_description: The organization should instill trust and reassurance in its stakeholders

controls.control: Develop clear, measurable, and achievable goals and objectives that align with the organization's mission and vision.
Conduct a SWOT (Strengths, Weaknesses, Opportunities, Threats) analysis to identify internal and external factors that may impact the organization's success.
Identify, assess, and prioritize risks, and develop strategies to mitigate or avoid them.
Define relevant KPIs to measure the organization's performance against its goals and objectives.

controls.control_title: Regularly Review and Update Business Continuity Plan
controls.control: Review and update the business continuity plan to ensure the organization can continue operations during disruptions or crises.

requirement_title: Improve Capability to Remain Effective During Disruptions
requirement: improving its capability to remain effective during disruptions
requirement_description: The organization should strengthen its ability to operate effectively during disruptions

controls.control: Develop a comprehensive disaster recovery plan that outlines steps to be taken in the event of a disruption, including data backup and system restoration procedures.
Deploy redundant systems and components to ensure continuity of operations in case of failure. This may include duplicate servers, network equipment, or data storage.
Routinely test the disaster recovery plan to ensure its effectiveness and identify any areas for improvement. This may involve simulated disruptions or full-scale exercises.
Store backup data in offsite locations to protect against on-site disasters. This may include cloud storage services or physical storage facilities.

requirement_title: Demonstrate Proactive Control of Risks Effectively and Efficiently
requirement: demonstrating proactive control of risks effectively and efficiently
requirement_description: The organization should manage risks in a strategic, efficient, and effective manner

controls.control: Regularly perform risk assessments to identify, prioritize, and mitigate potential risks. This includes both IT and business risks.
Develop and enforce policies that address risk management, including incident response, data protection, and business continuity. Regularly review and update these policies.

controls.control_title: Regular Security Training and Awareness Programs
controls.control: Provide regular security training to employees to ensure they are aware of potential risks and know how to respond. This includes phishing simulations, password management, and secure handling of data.
Create a cross-functional committee responsible for overseeing risk management efforts. This committee should include representatives from IT, legal, compliance, and business units.
Develop a dashboard to monitor key risks in real-time. This dashboard should provide visibility into the status of risk mitigation efforts and allow for easy reporting.

article_text: Clause 4 introduces the requirements necessary to establish the context of the BCMS applicable to the organization, as well as needs, requirements and scope.
requirement: Establish the context, needs, requirements, and scope for the Business Continuity Management System (BCMS)
requirement_description: The organization must define the applicability of its BCMS within the business environment.

controls.control: Clearly outline the areas, processes, systems, and personnel that will be covered by the Business Continuity Management System.
Determine essential business functions, dependencies, and critical resources required to maintain operations during disruptions.
Set measurable goals for the Business Continuity Management System that align with organizational objectives, risk appetite, and regulatory requirements.
Develop policies that provide a framework for managing business continuity risks and ensuring the effective implementation of the BCMS.
Create a comprehensive list of requirements necessary to establish, implement, maintain, and continually improve the Business Continuity Management System.

article_text: Clause 5 summarizes the requirements specific to top management’s role in the BCMS, and how leadership articulates its expectations to the organization via a policy statement.
requirement: Define the role of top management in the Business Continuity Management System (BCMS) and communicate expectations through a policy statement
requirement_description: Top management must define their role in BCMS implementation, maintenance, and improvement, and communicate this role to the organization.

controls.control: Develop a formal policy statement outlining the role and responsibilities of top management in the Business Continuity Management System (BCMS), including expectations, accountabilities, and commitment to its effective implementation.
Designate a senior executive as the BCMS owner responsible for overseeing the BCMS program, ensuring compliance with policies and regulations, and reporting to the board of directors.
Disseminate the BCMS policy statement to all employees, contractors, and other relevant parties, ensuring they understand their roles and responsibilities in maintaining business continuity.
Regularly review the BCMS policy statement to ensure it remains current, effective, and relevant to the organization's changing needs and risks.
Maintain a written record of the BCMS policy statement, including any updates or revisions, for reference and compliance purposes.

article_text: Clause 6 describes the requirements for establishing strategic objectives and guiding principles for the BCMS as a whole.
requirement: Establish strategic objectives and guiding principles for the Business Continuity Management System (BCMS)
requirement_description: The organization must set long-term goals and principles to guide the development, implementation, and maintenance of its BCMS.

controls.control: Establish clear, measurable objectives that align with the organization's overall goals and risk appetite.
Create a set of principles that guide decision-making, resource allocation, and actions related to the Business Continuity Management System.

controls.control_title: Document Strategic Objectives and Guiding Principles
controls.control: Formally document the strategic objectives and guiding principles for the BCMS, making them easily accessible to all relevant stakeholders.

requirement_title: Competence and Communication in BCMS Operations
article_text: Clause 7 supports BCMS operations related to establishing competence and communication on a recurring/as-needed basis with interested parties, while documenting, controlling, maintaining and retaining required documented information.
requirement: Maintain competence and effective communication within the Business Continuity Management System (BCMS) and manage required documentation
requirement_description: The organization must ensure that those involved in BCMS operations have the necessary skills and knowledge, and maintain proper communication with interested parties while managing required documents.

controls.control_title: Conduct Regular Training and Awareness Programs
controls.control: Regularly schedule training sessions to ensure all employees are aware of their roles and responsibilities within the BCMS, as well as any updates or changes.
Implement a system for organizing, storing, and retrieving BCMS documentation. This includes policies, procedures, plans, and records.

controls.control_title: Schedule Regular Reviews of BCMS Documentation
controls.control: Regularly review and update BCMS documentation to ensure it remains accurate, up-to-date, and effective.

article_text: Clause 8 defines business continuity needs, determines how to address them and
requirement: Identify and address business continuity needs
requirement_description: The organization must identify its critical functions and processes, and determine appropriate strategies for their continuation in the event of disruptions.

controls.control_title: Develop and Maintain Business Continuity Plan
controls.control: Create, test, and maintain a comprehensive business continuity plan that outlines procedures for responding to disruptions and ensuring the continuity of critical operations.
Identify essential business functions, dependencies, and resources required to maintain operations during a disruption.

controls.control_title: Establish Off-site Backup and Recovery Capabilities
controls.control: Implement off-site backup solutions for critical data and systems to ensure quick recovery in case of a disaster or disruption.
Perform regular business impact analysis to assess the potential effects of various threats on critical business functions and identify areas for improvement in the business continuity plan.
Develop and implement communication protocols to ensure effective internal and external communication during a disruption, including procedures for notifying employees, customers, and stakeholders.

article_text: controlling, maintaining and retaining required documented information. Clause 8 defines business continuity needs, determines how to address them and develops procedures to manage the organization during a disruption.
requirement: Develop and maintain business continuity plans
requirement_description: The organization should have plans in place to continue operations during disruptions, define needs, and establish procedures for managing the organization.

controls.control_title: Develop and Maintain Business Continuity Plans
controls.control: Create a comprehensive business continuity plan that outlines procedures to be followed in case of an unexpected disruption. Regularly review, update, and test the plan.
Assign a responsible individual or team to oversee the development, implementation, and maintenance of the business continuity plans.
Determine which business functions and processes are essential for maintaining operations during a disruption. Prioritize these areas in the continuity plan.
Designate secure off-site locations to store critical data and systems backups, ensuring they can be quickly accessed in case of an emergency.
Provide training for employees on the business continuity plan and conduct regular exercises to test its effectiveness.

article_text: Clause 9 summarizes the requirements necessary to measure business continuity performance, BCMS conformity with this document, and to conduct management review.
requirement: Measure business continuity performance, assess BCMS conformity, and conduct management reviews
requirement_description: The organization should monitor its business continuity performance, ensure adherence to the Business Continuity Management System (BCMS) guidelines, and regularly review the system.

controls.control: Develop key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the effectiveness of business continuity plans and regularly monitor their performance.

controls.control_title: Conduct Regular Business Continuity Management System Audits
controls.control: Perform periodic audits to ensure compliance with established policies, procedures, and standards related to the BCMS.

controls.control_title: Schedule Management Reviews for Business Continuity
controls.control: Establish a schedule for management reviews of the business continuity program to assess its effectiveness, identify areas for improvement, and make necessary adjustments.

article_text: Clause 10 identifies and acts on BCMS nonconformity and continual improvement through corrective action.
requirement: Identify and address nonconformities in the Business Continuity Management System (BCMS) and continuously improve it
requirement_description: The organization should identify any deviations from the BCMS, take corrective actions to rectify them, and strive for continuous improvement.

controls.control: Regularly audit the BCMS to identify any nonconformities, gaps, or weaknesses and take corrective actions
Develop a plan that outlines steps to address identified nonconformities, improve the BCMS, and implement best practices

controls.control_title: Implement Continuous Training and Awareness Programs
controls.control: Provide regular training and awareness programs for employees to ensure they understand their roles and responsibilities in the BCMS

article_text: This document conforms to ISO’s requirements for management system standards.
requirement: Ensure the Business Continuity Management System (BCMS) conforms to ISO standards
requirement_description: The BCMS should be designed and implemented in accordance with the guidelines provided by ISO management system standards.

controls.control: Develop, document, and communicate a clear policy statement for the BCMS, outlining its objectives and scope.
Define roles and responsibilities within the organization for BCMS management, including a BCMS team or steering committee.
Identify potential threats to business continuity, assess their impact, and prioritize risks based on likelihood and severity.
Determine the effects of a disruption on critical business processes, functions, and systems to support recovery efforts.
Create strategies, plans, and procedures for managing identified risks, ensuring business continuity during disruptions, and resuming normal operations as quickly as possible.

controls.control_title: Implement BCMS Training and Awareness Programs
controls.control: Provide training and awareness programs to employees on their roles and responsibilities in the BCMS, as well as any relevant procedures.
Regularly test and exercise BCMS plans to ensure their effectiveness and identify areas for improvement.
Keep BCMS documentation up-to-date, including policies, procedures, plans, and records of tests and exercises.

requirement_title: Confirmation of Self-Declaration by External Party
requirement: A party may seek confirmation of its self-declaration by an external party.
requirement_description: Parties have the option to request an external confirmation for their self-declared compliance.

controls.control: Establish a process to allow external parties to confirm the accuracy and completeness of self-declared information.
Develop a standardized request format for seeking confirmation from external parties.
Implement procedures to manage and respond to confirmations received from external parties in a timely and consistent manner.
Maintain records of all requests for confirmation, responses, and any subsequent actions taken based on the confirmations received.

requirement_title: Certification/Registration of BCMS by External Organization
requirement: A party may seek certification or registration of its Business Continuity Management System (BCMS) by an external organization.
requirement_description: Parties can opt to have their BCMS certified or registered by an external organization for validation.

controls.control_title: Engage External BCMS Certification or Registration Body
controls.control: Establish a relationship with a recognized and reputable external organization for the certification or registration of the Business Continuity Management System (BCMS)
Develop comprehensive documentation detailing the BCMS, including policies, procedures, and plans
Perform regular internal audits to assess the effectiveness of the BCMS and identify areas for improvement
Keep accurate records of all BCMS-related activities, including audits, training, and exercises
